designSystemProfile.name: DASH - Bold & Modern Tech
designSystemProfile.description: A design system characterized by bold typography, a vibrant primary color, and a dynamic layout that uses overlapping elements. It balances a clean, grid-based structure with brutalist-inspired, unconventional placements to create an energetic and confident feel.

overallStyle.vibe: Confident, energetic, and slightly edgy. Aims to be approachable yet professional.
overallStyle.layoutApproach: Asymmetrical layout with overlapping elements on a structured grid base. Uses generous whitespace to let bold elements breathe.

primary.name: Vibrant Purple
primary.usage: Used for primary call-to-action buttons, key headings, links, and decorative graphic elements to draw attention.

primary.name: Black
primary.usage: Used for all major headings and body copy for high contrast and readability.

onPrimary.name: White
onPrimary.usage: Text color for elements with a primary purple background, like buttons.

light.name: Off-White/Beige
light.usage: Main background color for the light theme, providing a warm, soft canvas.

darkSurface.name: Dark Gray
darkSurface.usage: Background for persistent UI elements like the sidebar navigation.

lightText.name: Light Gray
lightText.usage: Text color for UI elements on dark surfaces.

subtleBorders.name: Medium Gray
subtleBorders.usage: Borders for UI elements and grid lines.

heading.fontFamily: A bold, heavy-weight, extended sans-serif font (e.g., 'Neue Haas Grotesk Display Pro', 'Inter Black', 'Monument Extended').

h1.notes: Often breaks into multiple lines. Can have words highlighted with a solid color block background.

subheading.notes: Often used as a label for a section, e.g., 'THIS IS DASH'.

body.fontFamily: A clean, readable sans-serif font (e.g., 'Inter', 'Work Sans').

gridSystem.type: Single column for main content with a fixed sidebar.
gridSystem.background: A subtle, thin grid pattern is visible on the main background.

spacing.scale: Large scale, with significant vertical padding between sections (e.g., 8-12rem) to create clear separation and focus.
spacing.intraSection: Tighter spacing within components and text blocks.

sectioning.style: Page is divided into distinct, full-width sections.
sectioning.markers: Sections are often preceded by a numerical indicator (e.g., '01', '02') and a subheading in the primary color, creating a clear narrative flow.

overlappingElements.description: A key feature of the design. Images, text blocks, and decorative shapes frequently overlap each other, creating depth and a dynamic, collage-like effect.
overlappingElements.notes: Images are often placed behind or on top of large heading text.

navigation.activeState: Indicated by a solid circular dot (in ui.lightText color) next to the link.

primary.hoverEffect: Subtle change in brightness or scale.

logo.style: Blocky, two-line wordmark ('DA' on top, 'SH' on bottom).
logo.container: Contained within a solid black square.
logo.position: Top center or within the navigation.

geometricShapes.usage: Used as a large, dynamic background element to break up sections.

accentSymbols.usage: Used sparingly next to headings or as separators to add visual interest.

imagery.style: High-quality, professional photography of people in a modern office environment.
imagery.colorGrade: Natural with a slightly warm, desaturated look. Consistent toning across all images.

treatment.composition: Used as collage elements. Images are layered on top of each other, often with a slight, non-uniform rotation and a thin border to create a stacked-photos effect.
treatment.interactionWithLayout: Frequently overlaps with text, background shapes, and other UI elements to create a dynamic, integrated feel.
